review_text: This museum shows everything about Cebu's Christian faith journey. A must-see so you'll understand the faith roots of Cebuanos and the whole Philippines as well. ‚Ä¶

During my college years in Cebu City, I never had the opportunity to visit the Achdiocesan Museum. However, despite its ancient exterior, I found the museum to be very welcoming. Inside, one can view a variety of regional artifacts. I took this photo during a seminar in 2016.
If you want to see some artifacts about how Christianity started in the Philippines, this is the place you must visit.
One of the many historical museum in Cebu
Best place to learn of Cebu's Catholic past

Typical clerical Museum. The relics in the basement are okay. The upstairs exhibits seems a bit randomly selected. Of course the church has many items but just to present a wild selection is a bit questionable.
Nice garden.
Amazing place would come here again

The Archdiocesan Museum of Cebu provides a captivating exploration of Cebu City's religious and historical heritage. With its diverse collection of artifacts and artworks, the museum beautifully showcases the region's deep-rooted Catholic ‚Ä¶

By the place itself, i was blown by the story it holds during the Spanish era when Christianity began in Cebu. Beautiful religious statues and displays seen in the museum, including several historical narratives that surprised me.
Artifacts were very interesting including the paintings. Makes me want to learn more about its roots.
Religious artifacts have been preserved, most of which date back 200 to 300 years. The museum is stunning, and it is well worth a visit.

I recently had the opportunity to visit the Archdiocesan Museum of Cebu during Gabii sa Kabilin and was thoroughly impressed by its stunning collection of religious artifacts and exhibits. The museum offers a captivating glimpse into the ‚Ä¶

It is the¬†ecclesiastical museum¬†of the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Cebu. The focus of the museum is regional Church architecture and artifacts. Many of the items on display are from the Spanish colonial times. ‚Ä¶
Cebus treasures preserved in a building. Definitely a must visit while in the city.
Short journey of Cebu faith. Went there on Saturday 9AM. There is Php50 entrance.

Great, atmospheric place!
If you are in Cebu, be sure to visit, especially since this museum is very conveniently located, within walking distance from other historical attractions.

It is a good place to visit that every Catholic has to check it.

Tourists and even local residents  should visit this museum along with other museums nearby. These are the right places to learn the history of our place. For a very small fee of Php50, we could learn so much about rich history and culture.

If you like to see more Roman Catholics antiques this is the place for you.
The place is very beautiful, it's worth visiting. Don't miss this when you are within the vicinity of the Metropolitan Cathedral!
You see in this museum the antique things used in celebrating the holy eucharist.

This place is all about Christian history, so if you're not a believer, there's almost nothing to do there.
I was way more interested in the history of the building itself but during that cultural event no guide was available, too many people were inside.
Overall it's good. Just, hoped restroom had tissues or soap to wash your hand. And not combined for both genders. Maybe because it's still under construction? Not sure.
Nice. I've been visiting here for a lot of times already.

The entrance fee is 100 pesos. The wooden architecture is extraordinary.  at the entrance a guide tells you about the history of the building. It has a garden and the bells are exhibited in the garden.

the place is si clean and so solemn and quite. you see eelics and other things that were displayed there are amazing.

The Cathedral Museum of Cebu is a museum in Downtown Cebu City in the Philippines, (re)opened in November 2006. It is the ecclesiastical museum of the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Cebu. ‚Ä¶
Unfortunately it was closed and it didn't look like it would change in the near future.
It's okay, nothing special, but if you're into religious stuff, you'd enjoy there. For 50pesos I think it's worth it, you get to see religious relics, an old (spanish era) house and a lot of statues
Its a nice place to look also with there artifacts

The outside its nicely done. But being shadowed by "real churches," this nice place is a popular parking lot of people who don't really go here. It is huge. The inside is informative but .. (sorry) boring. For a museum, this has to upgrade and use engaging means to inform.
They have beautiful antique church items. Picture taking is not allowed, though, for security reasons.

In the museum you'll find religious relics, including images of Mother Mary, Jesus, and saints. You'll also see materials that were to build houses, establishments, etc. in the 19th century. There are a lot more artifacts and old images from the history of Catholicism in the city.
The history of roman catholic church in cebu  items from 16th century to 20th century museum
